name: hyfo easy start
tagline: Hydrological and Climate Forecasting R Package
body:
## Welcome 

hyfo is an **R package** which can be used as a tool for hydrology and climate forecasting. There are several tools in R including data processing, data visualization and data analysis. For hydrological and hydraulic modellers, hyfo can be a good preprocessing and postprocessing tool for you.

hyfo has been tested stable on windows platform.

## User manual

pdf version [here](http://media.wix.com/ugd/199c69_e1888b038d9b4302aceaa69250550655.pdf), easier to download and looks better.

html version [here](http://rpubs.com/rankthefirst/hyfo), easier to copy paste codes.

## Installation

You can directly download from the link above, and install in an R IDE e.g. Rstudio. **Or** use the **Simpler** way to install the latest version. 

If meet with some error during the installation, most probably is because of the conflicts between packages (e.g., "Rcpp" and "sp"), you can just follow the error message and re-install the required packages, they are all on CRAN, which is very convenient.
```{r, results='hide'}
  install.packages('devtools')
  # Ignore the warning that Rtool is not installed, unless you want other function from devtools.
  # If "devtools" is already installed in your computer, you can directly run the following code.
  devtools::install_github('Yuanchao-Xu/hyfo')
```

## Updates
2015-8-4: 

New version 1.1.1 was released, with the function of loading and writing NetCDF file.
Adding time series analysis to `getPreciBar`, it can now deal with both grid data and single time series. 
Some changes made to the functions to make it more convenient to be called. 

next:

Bias correction about the forecasting data will be added. 
Downscaling function will be added.
result analysis will be added.

For historical releases and the introduction of updates about each version, please click [here](https://github.com/Yuanchao-Xu/hyfo/releases) 

## Feedback

Any bugs and suggestions are welcomed, please email the author Yuanchao Xu (xuyuanchao37@gmail.com) or leave a comment on github.
